image.altText: The sign outside the South Australian Coroners Court.

props.synopsis: The South Australian Supreme Court has quashed a certificate giving a former SA Health employee immunity during an inquest into three ramping deaths.Â

title.children: Doctor loses immunity over ramping inquest evidence

image.altText: A man with light brown hair wearing a blue shirt

props.synopsis: A "predatory" photographer who committed child sex offences has been slammed by his victims in court and labelled a "monster" who ruined their lives. Warning: This story contains details readers may find confronting.

title.children: Adelaide photographer who sexually abused kids labelled 'monster' in court

image.altText: A sheep loading ramp is shown balancing precariously on a tin drum on its side behind a stock truck.

props.synopsis: The Crap Loading Ramps of Australia Facebook page attracts lots of attention online, but the founder says its tongue-in-cheek posts highlight a serious issue in the livestock industry.

title.children: Truckies fed up with 'major' safety issue get creative to highlight danger

image.altText: An orange wave buoy rider in the ocean

props.synopsis: The wave buoy off the coast of Kangaroo Island provides critical data for fishers, commercial divers, shipping companies and surfers but it has been deactivated since September, prompting questions about its fate.

title.children: Broken wave buoy leaves fishers and divers without critical information for months

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

props.synopsis: A woman who disguised herself as someone living with a disability and used a solution which had "a smell of chilli about it" and a homemade taser to steal jewellery was trying clear debts owed to a drug syndicate, a court has heard.

title.children: Woman who sprayed shopkeeper's face with suspected chilli solution faces court

image.altText: Jacob and Helen smile at the camera while Helen puts her arm around her son

props.synopsis: A specialised dental service is helping to fill a big cavity in an industry that has been largely inaccessible for people with disability. For Jacob, 20, it has been life changing.Â

title.children: For people living with disability, accessing a dentist can be a challenge

image.altText: A close-up of the blades of a windmill, standing over a dirt path and some lakes.

props.synopsis: Millions of tonnes of soil and rock from the Torrens to Darlington tunnel project will be processed at a site in Adelaide's north, despite concerns about the potential contamination risk to nearby wetlands.

title.children: Environmentalists raise concerns Gillman proposal will put wetlands at risk

image.altText: Heat makes for restless nights

props.synopsis: Public life ground to a halt, many lost power, and scores of people died behind closed doors. What sounds like the start of a post-apocalyptic movie is in fact Melbourne in January 2009.

title.children: Australia's deadliest natural disaster flew under the radar but killed hundreds

image.altText: A small square robot has four white wheels, it wheels through white sand

props.synopsis: A Queensland-based consortium will design, build and operate the Australian first Moon rover, which is set to launch later this decade.

title.children: Builder chosen for Roo-ver, the little robot who will head to the Moon

image.altText: A close up on a two-month-old baby's face, with its right hand on its cheek.

props.synopsis: The family of a baby injured in a shocking home invasion in Alice Springs thanks the community for its support after a fundraiser drew more than $52,000 in donations.

title.children: $52,000 raised for baby injured in Alice Springs home invasion

image.altText: A single bed in a room at the new youth training centre

props.synopsis: Nearly one in two incarcerated children in South Australia have been prescribed a supplement to help them fall asleep, amid concerns about "unusual" night-time behaviours.

title.children: Doctors concerned by melatonin prescriptions to children at detention centre

image.altText: KI desal plant 2

props.synopsis: The desalination plant is meant to service American Beach, Baudin Beach, Island Beach and Sapphiretown, but some people in those areas have been told they cannot be connected.Â

title.children: New $150m Kangaroo Island desal plant unable to connect to all households

image.altText: A river with very green water snakes through trees.

props.synopsis: Extreme heat forecast across western NSW has river rangers, locals and the state government worried about the possibility of another mass fish kill.

title.children: Fish kill fears as Darling River turns a sickly shade of green

image.altText: An aerial view showing land with trees and the ocean.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners express immense disappointment at the approval of Billy Lights Point as the site for a desalination plant in South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: 'Wrong location' for $330m desal plant, traditional owners say

image.altText: Port Vila earthquake damage

props.synopsis: Australia is urgently sending assistance, including emergency medical and search and rescue teams, to Vanuatu following a powerful earthquake.

title.children: Vanuatu locals describe 'mass casualty' event following earthquake

image.altText: A 3D globe showing the locations of solar farms around the world as spikes.

props.synopsis: Satellite imagery reveals the staggering rise of solar farms around the world in recent years. Can Australia get on board?

title.children: Fossil fuels are being 'eaten alive' by the solar rush

image.altText: Ravi Ashwin holds up his hands as Mitch Marsh looks on in the background

props.synopsis: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin announces his retirement shortly after the Gabba Test ends in a draw after another rain-soaked day five.

title.children: India great retires after rain-soaked Gabba Test ends in a draw

image.altText: Hugh Marks

props.synopsis: Hugh Marks's ascension to the top of the media pile was not via the traditional route. Now he has one of Australia's toughest assignments.

title.children: Hugh Marks merged Nine and Fairfax. Now he's poised to lead the ABC

image.altText: Two men whose faces are obscured walk up to a nurse's station at a hospital.

props.synopsis: Mike* has an acquired brain injury and schizoaffective disorder, he is also the recipient of an NDIS plan worth $660,000 a year â making him a lucrative catch for unscrupulous providers.Â

title.children: Family of NDIS participant fears he's been 'kidnapped' for $670k plan

image.altText: A girl smiling in a school photo wearing a black hijab,

props.synopsis: The father and stepmother of a 10-year-old girl found dead in her UK home have been sentenced to life in prison for her murder after a trial heard of years of abuse amounting to "torture".

title.children: 'You are sadists': Father and stepmother jailed for life over murder of 10-year-old Sara Sharif

image.altText: Generic photo of people swimming in the ocean at an Adelaide beach on a hot day.

props.synopsis: Christmas Day is looking dry and sunny for most of the country, with a distinctive lack of rain-producing low-pressure systems, troughs or cold fronts appearing on the charts.

title.children: Warm Christmas Day forecast for most of Australia with heatwave to follow

image.altText: A booking photograph of Luigi Mangione at State Correctional Institution

props.synopsis: Accused CEO killer Luigi Mangione committed an act of domestic terrorism when he fatally shot a healthcare executive in Manhattan, US authorities allege.

title.children: Luigi Mangione charged with terrorism, NYPD slams public 'celebration'

image.altText: The front of an inner-city worker's cottage with a yellow front door and fence

props.synopsis: Dr Laura Ryan's ambitious plan is one step closer, with her local council announcing it is reviewing rules that prevent owners from putting solar panels on street-facing roofs.

title.children: Sydney woman fights to make inner-city house off-grid

image.altText: A mother giving her daughter pills out of a square bottle.

props.synopsis: A major review of evidence on ADHD treatment in adults has found stimulant drugs and one type of non-stimulant are the only effective treatments for reducing core symptoms in the short term.

title.children: ADHD drugs reduce symptoms in adults but don't improve quality of life, study finds

image.altText: A line-up of cars on a road that is partially underwater.

props.synopsis: The dams are spilling, the ground is sodden, and more rain is on the way for parts of Queensland, so is it time to fear another major flood event?

title.children: Queenslanders urged not to panic but prepare for possible floods

image.altText: Brunette haired woman with bandage over missing nose

props.synopsis: In Australia, anyone needing a facial prosthetic, such as a nose or ear, must pay for it themselves. However, those below the neck can be paid for through government funding or private health insurance.

title.children: Cancer survivor can't afford new nose under prosthetics funding rules

image.altText: the wind blows balck and yellow flags with yellow writing attached to fences of building sites with buildings behind

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has accepted all of the recommendations of a report into unlawful activity and corruption at government construction sites.

title.children: New complaints mechanism for Victoria's 'rotten' construction sector

image.altText: Two Bitcoins held in both hands with a Binance price chart opened in the background.

props.synopsis: The corporate regulator is suing crypto firm Binance Australia Derivatives for alleged consumer protection failures. Australian stocks swung between gains and losses but finished in the red.

title.children: Crypto firm Binance Australia sued by ASIC, ASX slips â as it happened

image.altText: Smiling female student with long brown hair, wearing a brown dress and gold necklace, standing in front of a NSW education sign.

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of NSW students were awarded their HSC today, though the day has less significance now that large numbers already have their university place offers, an expert says.

title.children: Here are the HSC results for the class of 2024 in five charts

image.altText: Woman sitting in room with blue background

props.synopsis: A mother of two is calling for better training of psychologists after her ex-partner confessed to wanting to kill himself and their children.

title.children: Mother claims therapist ignored ex-husband's filicide warning signs

image.altText: A dirty brown foam sits on the surface of a river.

props.synopsis: A leading water researcher says residents are right to be concerned about the discovery of PFOS in carp from the Belubula River in Central West NSW.

title.children: Food chain fears as 'forever chemicals' found in fish along NSW river

image.altText: A woman hugs her dog, with a tent in the background.

props.synopsis: The City of Moreton Bay issues a blanket ban forbidding homeless people from keeping pets or publicly sleeping in vans.

title.children: Queensland council bans pets for rough sleepers amid homeless crackdown

image.altText: Men in workwear walk down stairs onto an airport tarmac.

props.synopsis: Energy projects in WA's Pilbara are predicted to drive population up 35 per cent by 2030, triggering concerns about spiralling housing costs and worsening service availability.

title.children: Weekly rent hits $1,100 in WA city where population predicted to boom

image.altText: A happy family smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A dying Queensland mother living with cystic fibrosis has again cheated death with a heart and double lung transplant.

title.children: Queensland mother on transplant list for just six hours before life-saving call

image.altText: The silhouettes of a military vehicle and soldier against an orange sunset sky along the Gaza border.

props.synopsis: Hamas, Israel and the United States have indicated a deal could be close that would allow for the first truce between the warring sides since late last year.

title.children: Optimism as Israel and Hamas hold 'serious and positive' truce talks
